intro: Strychnodaphne lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf strychnodaphne, is a member of the Loganiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruits are follicles that contain toxic seeds, a trait common to many species in its family. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
